name: Titanium.Analytics
summary: Used for transmitting developer-defined Analytics events to the Appcelerator Analytics product.

methods.name: featureEvent
methods.summary: Sends a feature event for this application session.
methods.description:
From version "6.0.0", the JSON that is being sent will be validated. The JSON can have a maximum of 5 nested levels, 1000 serialised byte length, 25 keys per level and key length of up to 50 characters.

If this is successful, you will get a return number of 0. -1 is returned if it is a JSON Validation error. -2 is returned if Analytics is disabled.

parameters.name: data
parameters.summary: Extra data related to the event. Must be serializable as JSON.

returns.summary: It returns 0 if it is successful. Otherwise, it is an error.

methods.name: filterEvents
methods.summary: Sets a list of events that will not be sent to the Analytics server.

methods.name: navEvent
methods.summary: Sends a navigation event for this application session. Not displayed in Analytics UI.

parameters.name: from
parameters.summary: String describing the location the user navigated from.

parameters.name: to
parameters.summary: String describing the location the user navigated to.

parameters.name: data
parameters.summary: Extra data related to the event. The object must be serializable as JSON.

properties.name: lastEvent
properties.summary: JSON representation of the last Analytics event generated.
properties.description: LastEvent is the JSON version of the last event prepared to be sent to Appcelerator during the application's session. This value may be null or undefined if no such event was queued.

properties.name: optedOut
properties.summary: Allows the user to opt out from Analytics during runtime to comply to GPDR.
properties.description:
Once opted out, no Analytics events will be sent anymore. If implemented to the end user, ensure to check if the user is opted out before trying to send an Analytics event. In case you do not guard the Analytics call, it will be ignored silently.

Here is an example of a guarded Analytics call:

if (!Ti.Analytics.optedOut) {
  Ti.Analytics.featureEvent('gdpr_rocks');
}

Read more about GDPR on the official website.
